Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING”
Reviews.Author: Suburbguy
Reviews.Content: I checked in late on the first night of what was to be 2 nights for business. The place was dingy, but passable. Upon getting up in the morning, the sun was coming in through the window and I noticed a dried substance on the headboard with was white and still had some residue on it. I am guessing it was ejac. Quick shower, packed and down to the desk to explain issue and to get another room key and went to work. Got back from work, went to room number 2 and checked it out and when I checked under the mattress for bed bugs or other nasties, I found 2 used tampon applicators. I checked out of this hole. Disgusting, disgusting, disgusting. The GM Jeff tried to tell me the substance on the headboard was paint. Did I say disgusting?

Reviews.Title: “We got for cheap, old forniture, waffles on breaky”
Reviews.Author: Danielle_saopaulo
Reviews.Content: Shower was also nice. We spent a nite there, havent tried the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Deal with the Deals..”
Reviews.Author: jpearl_vm
Reviews.Content: Family of 2 and 2 children on our Christmas vacation.. Great deal on hotels.com. Loved the location since I had no intentions of walking anywhere. Del Taco, gas station, mom and pop stores right across the street. Just up the block, grocery store, CVS, etc. Very close to freeway access. About 15 min drive to Universal Studios and Hollywood walk of fame. Hotel could use a face lift and modern decor. Its a 2-story hotel with no elevators. But I preferred to be on the 2nd floor because of the balcony. I felt safer considering the bottom level room lanais were open to parking lot. Ample free parking. Room was quite spacious and odorless. Could use pillow top beds and new (flat screen) tv. Stains on drapes and slow drainage in tub. *There was a bottel cap opener attached to wall next to tub.. Hmmm?? Speaks for itself. LOL! The free breakfast buffet was better than most. DIY waffles, cereals, boiled eggs. Enough to start the morning! The indian man at front desk was very helpful, cant say the same for the others. The girls should at the least smile.. Life cant be that bad, right? I would like to suggest a printer for the "business office" (one pc in lobby). Hotel also provided 24 hr use of microwave in lobby, as well as hot coffee/tea. Will recommend to stay for the budget traveler!

Reviews.Title: “Simple hotel good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Annastina
Reviews.Content: My family, 10 year old kid and husband, stayed in Vallye inn & conference center in Mission Hills for 3 weeks august 2011! We planned to stay for only 3 days and move around the LA area, but due to the cool pool and good location to explore the city we stayed for our whole vacation. The room is a little bit run down but clean and good size for 3 person. The room facing pool is quiet, on fridays and saturdays there is lots of people by the pool though, but they close the pool at 10 pm and after that it is very quiet. There is quite good continental breakfast but at weekends when the hotel was fully booked they run out of the most at breakfast, lacking eggs, toast, no fruit and so on. The kids loves the waffel machine you get warm fresch ones every morning. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel should remove the wall to wall carpets in the rooms and the lobby and change the run down sofas in the lobby and this would give the whole hotel a huge lift. The wall to wall carpets upstairs smell cat pee sometimes. This is not a luxury hotel but for this price this gives very good value for the money. the area around is not so nice, I wouldnÂ´t take a walk in the area even during the daytime, but you have some simple restaurants around to get take away food and 2 food markets close by to get some drinks to your fridge and enjoy the sunset on the balcony. The best thing with the hotel is the pool and the friedly staff. ItÂ´s nice to get back to hotel after dusty sightseeing and take a swim in the pool in the evenings. The Garden area around the pool is nice with all the flowers and birds. We were often sleeping with the door open and heard the mornings birds. There is free wireless in the rooms and free parking giving added value. For those not having an own laptop you have a computer outside the reception to borrow.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: KennyDies
Reviews.Content: Myself and my friends are on a road trip around California from England and this was the bargain of the trip. Ignore other bad reviews, for the money the rooms are big, a great location. Is only a $40 taxi to City Walk and ample parking. This hotel is not the savoy so don't expect the same level of hotel or cost. If you want a cheap hotel with a bed and a big pool then go for it. I am not sure why people would feel unsafe in this area, we saw no examples of any "illegal" activity. For the life of me I can't remember the name of it but the bar round the corner was awsome. It didn't sell food but you could purchase chinese from next door to eat it it. Was only $8 for a pitcher of beer. I can't give a review for breakfast as I would rather sleep than get up but my friends said it was nothing special but gave them a good start for the day. The indian guy that checked us in did not seem all there but it still only took us 10 mins with no fuss. I stay in nice hotels with work so I see all ranges of hotels but for the $70 a night I can't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Run, Dont Walk”
Reviews.Author: Anthony C
Reviews.Content: This place is not only shady, its an outright dangerous false advertisement. When we pulled up, I thought, what the heck, its late and Im tired from a 5+ hour drive. My wife checked us in, I observed some party type activity in the rooms with patios and balconies that were opened up and were viewable from the parking lot. Its a Tuesday, not a Fri or Sat where this would seem normal. It seemed questionable. Once checked in, I looked at the map to our room and drove around the back to park closest to our room. Again, I noticed activity that was now beyond questionable, but quite clearly illegal. I went into our room, never even put my luggage down, looked at my wife and kids and said "No way are we staying here", The room was old, the locks on the doors were less than secure, which raises the immediate question as to "What goes on in this place"? Why have the locks obviously been replaced more than an upgrade, but a repair from being broken? This place was not safe, not secure for even your belongings, but down right dangerous. There is quite evidently illegal activities going on. We quickly got back into the car, and went back to the front where the gal at the front desk attempted to argue that this was a quiet and safe place, to which I calmly said, " You know more than I do what goes on here, and I dont think you want me to call the police and concern the people that stay here on a constant basis and disrupt the obvious illegal business that is going on here." Only after this, did she agree to refund our Credit Card. I would have left and taken it up with my Credit Card Co. before risking my families safety at this place. I even would have eaten the $100 for my life and and families was worth much more than staying at this place. My wife booked it based on the pictures from their website. Only after we got to another hotel, did I view the website and agree with my wife, the website is awesome, place looks nice, resort like. We paid $98 for our room, and got a room at the Marriott for $115. I would expect something like this if the room was $60-70 a night, but for $90 plus tax, you expect a decent, safe environment. This place is truly truly the worst hotel I have ever experienced. You have been informed.

Reviews.Title: “Run from this place as fast as you possible can”
Reviews.Author: Funbaychic
Reviews.Content: This hotel's website is a complete facade - it is nothing like the pictures. Upon arrival, I looked for the tall, well groomed gentleman depicted at the front desk - and found a squat, none to pleasant Indian gentleman with less than perfect English at the front desk. After checking in, I went upstairs to the dingiest, dirtiest hallway I have ever seen ( beige carpet turned black, woodwork along the walls that was cracked and falling off the wall. The room door did not seal - I could see light all around it and a swift kick from outside would easily open it. The carpet was filthy with cigarette burns (mind you, this was a non-smoking room), the curtains had dry rot and the "sheers" had something black all over them (mold?). I went to open the curtains and the bolts holding the curtain rod into the popcorn ceiling came out of the ceiling - it was being held up by a prayer. I opened the sliding glass doors long enough to stop outside on the balcony, went back in, locked the glass doors, pulled to make sure the lock was in place and the entire window jam pulled away from the frame! Two chairs in the room were worn and had black arms from constant filthy arms resting on them. The walls had peeling paint and stains, as well as gouges in them. I went out to find some place for dinner and the neighborhood is horrible - tattoo parlor and low rent mexican restaurants around the corner. I felt very unsafe outside. Upon returning to the room, I shoved a chair against the door as it was apparent that anyone could gain access with a good kick. I suffered until 2:30 a.m. listening to the neighbors laugh and party. I finally had to call the front desk to complain. I promise you that this will be the worst hotel stay of your life - you will fill unsafe, repulsed by the surrounding dirt and spend a sleepless night listening to your neighbors through paper thin walls.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel”
Reviews.Author: huntdealz
Reviews.Content: I would never ever stay at this hotel. It was in really bad shape, the curtains had stains, the bed was squeaking, the room door was jammed and wouldnt open without hitting hard on it. i had booked it through hotwire and they had reserved a single bed room for 4 adults. i had to call hotwire and ask them to send a fax to the hotel, so they would give me 2 bed room. The parking around and the area is shady too. Its nothing like in the photos. Watch OUT, stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 Star Hotel... But a very descent one”
Reviews.Author: andresc78
Reviews.Content: Before I booked I read many reviews and I was a little afraid about this one. From the pictures it seemed really good but since we are from the East Coast had no clue on what to expect. It was super convenient! A food store less than a block away, Pizza Hut right next, neighborhood is very quiet. For this price you CANNOT get anything better in this area. Trust me!! We attended a seminary for 4 days in North Hills (bad area) and we loved this hotel. Free breakfast and Internet! Room is a little outdated, not a lot of channels on TV... but Free Internet! nowdays you dont get that. Room smelled good...and shower was good too (outdated but ok). Only thing is the bed is not a five star bed but again... you get what you paid for. Staff is super good!! I actually got a good rate and my friend and wife were coming later on that night and they gave them the same rate than us. Very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: berry21065
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, quiet rooms, plenty of space in the room, nice view of the pool area which is a great feature complete with palm trees, easy access to and from the freeways and eating establishments. It is also close to many attractions that individuals or families travel to see. The complimentary breakfast was excellent including the ability to make your own waffles.

Reviews.Title: “Older, but stillo great”
Reviews.Author: CaroleSh
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Mission Hills Inn (now renamed Valley Inn) several times and been very pleased with it. While it is an older property (and some things are a bit dated), the overall value is quite good. Rooms are most spacious (with a decent balcony including chairs) and if you ask for one facing the pool, the view out the room is also quite good. This also avoids the traffic noise from the street. There is a lovely, and very large pool that families will greatly enjoy. Being close to 6 Flags doesn't hurt and this would be a good base of operations. If you avoid the early AM rush, the drive down 405 to Santa Monica and UCLA/Brentwood) is a breeze. There is a new owner/management team and they are most helpful and gracious (Yvette in particular but she is not the only one). The breakfast includes waffles, cereal, muffins, etc. and is more than adequate. If you are a regular, you can most likely get a break on their prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price and conveneant for LA”
Reviews.Author: journalWestSussex
Reviews.Content: We stayed for about a week, staff seemed friendly at the time, and I can remember the receptionist very well, his name was Fred, always a smile on his face and greets you well. this all seems fine, all I can say is that we got the insurance money back for the two Ipods, just think about it for a minute as i left my bag locked behind the reception untill we left for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Fair price, good staff”
Reviews.Author: Heartless_9
Reviews.Content: True the hotel is old but for the price it wasn't that bad. I have to say this was the first hotel in California that kept to the price I was confirmed for and didn't try to charge more once we arrived. The staff was always friendly and working hard to please the guests. We had clean towels, and bedding each day. The breakfast provided was okay too. The hotel is in a good location for getting on the 405, 5 and 118. There are plenty of gas stations, restaurants and even a grocery store "Ralphs" near the hotel. The hotel is situated in a neighborhood setting so more like home.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the cheap price.”
Reviews.Author: svk033
Reviews.Content: This place was the most affordable option in the area, but it wasn't worth it in the slightest. The room was filthy, it's right off of a busy road, the bed had to be atleast 25 years old. Avoid at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Did Not Meet Expectations”
Reviews.Author: CATraveler1000
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two night stay at the Guest House Inn. We never have stayed in a hotel where there were so many problems. We constantly had to report issues to the front desk. We would not recommend staying here. Our experience: - The entry door did not securely shut and lock. It looked as if someone had broken in prior. - The mattress was old and in poor condition. Donâ€™t expect comfort here. - Ants and crickets in the bathroom. - We noticed the bathroom floor was not cleaned well. Dead carcasses of prior insects. We could only imagine what was in the dark carpet where dirt isnâ€™t as visible. - Cable TV was advertised, however, it wasnâ€™t working. We noticed the coaxial cable from the wall to the television was broken and had been taped back together by electrical tape. - The temperature control dial on the heater was broken. The heater worked, but we were unable to control the temperature. - They were unable to move us to a different room on the first day we arrived because there were plumbing issues in the main building that were being repaired. They did move us to a different room on the second day. The second room was in the main building and it was in better condition. The cable TV still didnâ€™t work and they had to swap out television sets. It appears that you will have cable if you are in a room where the TV supports it. - We did have the advertised waffle breakfast one of the days we were there. The other day, it wasnâ€™t available. - We werenâ€™t sure if the pool was open or closed. It had water in it but it was full of leaves. It was far from being something that we would want to swim in. Overall, it was simply too much of a hassle to stay here. The hotel is old and not well maintained. The pictures displayed on the hotel website donâ€™t paint an accurate picture of what you can expect.

Reviews.Title: “shabby hotel, won't go back”
Reviews.Author: DianeRD
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel in the past when it was under a different name and saw that it had been remodeled so we expected it to be better than it was years ago. This was not the case. The room was shabby, dents in the wall, stains on the ironing board, sagging countertop. We turned on the heater and it blew dust into the air. We won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Two enthusiastic thumbs up!!!”
Reviews.Author: lcbrin
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our 2 night stay here. I was not expecting much based on the price and age of the hotel. Within a 20 mile radius, everything else for under 70 dollars had horrible reviews on several travel review websites. The decent reviewed ones were well over 125 per night. So when I found this one online for 68 per night and a 71% approval rating, I booked it. But I was still hesitant. The location is great. Quiet area, the street was not too busy. Just minutes from Magic Mountain and Univeral Studios. And about 15 minutes from Hollywood. We went to 2 days of tapings of The Price Is Right at the CBS studios and it only took us 20 minutes to get there from our hotel. I highly recommend it for that because the hotels around the studio in Hollywood all range between 135 - 700 per night!!! The room was very large! Fridge, hair dryer, large vanity area with chair, lots of mirrors, large tv with tons of channels, a computer in the lobby for guest use and free WiFi, nice private patio with chairs over looking the beautiful pool area. We did not use the pool but we saw about 10 others using it and they looked like they were enjoying it. There was also a continental breakfast but we left our room by 5 am each day so I did not see it. The condition of the hotel is good. It definately could use some renovation because it is an older hotel. But there were not cracks in the tubs, toilets, or sinks. No mildew or odd smells. Comfy but noisy bed. Cool AC. Parking was sufficient for a Sunday and Monday night. Not sure how it would be on a weekend though. Bottom line is we will definately stay at the GuestHouse Inn San Fernando Valley again!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good - a lot of thumbs up from me!”
Reviews.Author: shuster8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at several hotels in the last 2 weeks so I will base my review on comparing them. We stayed here so that we could be closer to the Universal Studios area and it was only about 10 miles away. Room was nice and large, had a separate area between the bed and bathroom divided by a wall which was neat, we had a queen bed and it came with a couch chair on the side for watching tv which we thought was a nice bonus. We were on the 2nd floor, so we also had a balcony which is separated from everyone else and had a great view of palm trees and the pool not too far. The slider though was very old and it was extremely difficult to open and almost impossible to close so we ended up not being able to use to balcony which was too bad as I would have enjoyed sitting out on it. The bed was fine, firm though which for my back was fine but other people might find it a bit too hard, but it didn't have any dips or lumps. OH ya and the water pressure in the shower was awesome! The best I've ever experienced! The only complaints I guess were even though the carpet looked nice, you got dirty feet so it obviously was quite dirty and they should probably clean the carpets more. Also, several times I was woken by squeely running water in the pipes in the walls, I guess since there is such good water pressure, it also makes it noisy. There was quite a few people staying in the room next to me and I think they had showers late at night and early in the morning - so I don't think that will always be a problem. The grounds were very nice, and I really liked the pool (very large, great temperature and surrounded by palm trees). The only thing that ruined it for me was that people were smoking all around the pool, and I am allergic to smoke and besides which don't want kids around it either. Other hotels we were at all had no smoking in the pool area! The pool area was large enough that they could have one corner for smokers only so at least then you could go to the other end of the pool and escape them, but I really think they should just make the pool area non smoking. Also, which was disgusting to me, there was half used cigarettes left by guests all around the pools edge (which I still can't believe people would do that). Also, they badly need someone to do pool checks with a broom and sweeper several times a day around that pool, we were there for three days, and the same cigarettes and pieces of garbage like napkins were around the pool edge the whole time. The rest of the hotel grounds and in the common area were really clean, so this is the only area that was a problem while we were there. Again make the pool non smoking and then they won't have cigarette garbage around the pool for little kids to get into or step on. As I said the pool was really nice! and hopefully in the future it will be non smoking as I would love to stay there again as the pool is always a huge selling feature for me and this is the best pool/palm tree view I've stayed at. They also had a really nice lounge area upon entering the hotel, the front desk staff were nice. They have a complimentary computer which was a huge bonus to me, as it had built in card readers so you can upload your camera pictures to a flash drive or even facebook. The only problem of course was that this one guy hogged the computer all day, even though it said (limit of 30 min.) and even when I'd point it out, he didn't care. I think they should either have a sign-in book with time started, so people will not take advantage and a timer that rings when there time is up, so the person can't pretend they didn't notice the time. I also think 15 min intervals is more reasonable when other people are waiting, as most people just want to quickly jump on and check their email or look up an address before they head out. The guy that was on it all day while we were there was just using it to pass the time all day. Continental breakfast was great also, and they have a nice large area to eat in and a tv to watch. They had one waffle maker, and then a variety of things such as cereal, toast, english muffins, danish, coffee and juices and even hard boiled eggs and some kind of scrambled egg patty. They also had onsite laundry that worked really nicely for a good price. There is a 7-11 across the street and a Pizza Hut on the corner and another restaurant next door, and the hotel is close access to the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Ghetto Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TehPondHopper
Reviews.Content: We had the misfortune of booking this hotel online based on trip advisor reviews . We originally booked this hotel for 4 days but checked out after just one. We are not overly picky people either but this place is just nasty. 1st , The bed is very old and hard and squeeky and IS STAINED . The pillows look to be as old as the building. The bed was so bad that we slept in our clothes on top of it using more clothes for pillows. I still feel dirty and was worried about getting lice or bed bugs. If that isnt enough to send you elsewhere , the bathroom was dirty with pubic hairs and the tub did not drain at all . It took over an hour for the shower water to finish draining afterwards. This hotel is greasy feeling everywhere , the handles, the phone , the walls , all dirty and greasy and it has "A BAD SMELL". Also they do not have wireless internet , they advertise it but they do not have it. Stay Elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: tunamac
Reviews.Content: We were very surprised when we arrived at the GuestHouse International. Based on the pics and several reviews, we were leary. However, the rooms were clean and spacious enough for 3 high maintenance women. We stayed 3 nights and were pleased with the hot breakfast as well as a responsive staff. When we needed extra towels, blankets, pillows - they were very accomodating. The pool was great and very clean. The beds were okay but hey, we only paid $69.00 a night. Would definitely recommend especially for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't ever stay here!”
Reviews.Author: sfoso
Reviews.Content: We had hopes for this property since it was close to relatives. But it was a scary place. The door frame and lock were none too solid, and there were mosquitos throughout the room. Cigarette burns in this "non-smoking" room were found on the curtains and bed blanjet. The tv remote didn't work, and the bathtub drain worked so slowly we were up to our ankles in water. But for the fact that we only slept there we didn't try to change rooms, but it was a bad sign that they never responded to our detailed letter (which they did receive, per the corporate honchos) outlining these poor conditions. The lack of follow-up was evident and I encourage you to go elsewhere in the San Fernando valley.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool for the kids and for visiting relatives to the North Valley”
Reviews.Author: LawyerLady438
Reviews.Content: We live in Granada Hills so we send all our visiting friends and relatives to this hotel to stay for a clean and comfortable location with friendly service at a great rate. We also book a room or two in the summer so that we can take the kids and their friends for a great swin in their HUGE pool. Although it is nothing near 4-star, it does have in-room videos, coffee pot and a great little diner next store for breakfast to go with the great pool in the center that all the rooms seem to look onto. If you live in the North Valley in Mission Hills, Granada Hills area, I'd say your guests could not go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly acceptable”
Reviews.Author: chelleyellie
Reviews.Content: We were worried about what to expect after reading some of the other reviews, especially the one about the stench of urine. We were pleasantly surprised. The receptionist was abrupt and rude which initally gave us a bad opinion but the room and bathroom was clean and it passed our baby test, (we allowed our 10month old on the carpet!) The fridge and television were old but they met our needs. The rooms could do with updating and there was a socket missing off one of the plugs which was a unsafe, but it was behind the bedside cabinet. All in all it is worth staying there if you don't want to be too far from the highway which leads you to all the sites. 45 mins to Hollywood, 30 mins to Universal Studios, an hour to Santa Monica. In case you fancy a night out in Hollywood it costs $70-80 in a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel because the location was ideal for our trip to Los Angeles. We liked the spacious size of the rooms and it has a seperate vanity area which was nice. The courtyard and pool area was really a nice feature and all the rooms have patios or balconies facing it. The breakfast was really good and the attendant was very helpful. The front desk clerks were very friendly and helpful. I would reccommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel because it was the least expensive one in the area and still close to my parent's house. After we checked in I would later regret my decision to stay here and wished I had spent the extra money for peace of mind. We were first given a room facing Sepulveda Blvd, which was noisy because that street is extremely busy. We immediately knew that we couldn't stay in that room and asked to be switched. The second room wasn't even cleaned yet and we were relocated in to a third room that was clean and quiet. The room overall was okay except that the security chain could've been ripped out of the door frame with one good kick of the door. The surrounding neighborhood was worrisome as well as some of the guests that stayed there during the two nights (we had booked four nights but changed hotels) we were there. For example, there was a guest on the first floor who was blarring music out of his truck and grilling something on a table top barbecue at around 9pm. My biggest lesson learned from this adventure is to spend the extra money for peace of mind and safety.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain... convenient location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The shining centerpiece of this hotel is the pool and grounds. The rooms are fine... clean and with the usual amenities including in-room coffee, wireless network, ironing board/iron... while somewhat dated and not the most stylish, the bed and furniture were fine. The staff is very pleasent and helpful. We found the location to be ideal and centrally located with an easy ride to Six Flags, Hollywood, Universal Studios, Santa Monica/Beach in no more than 1/2 hour. The access also means that there is a bit of traffic noise on weekday mornings but it moderates quickly. There are good family restaurants nearby (within 1 block) and shopping for necessities close at hand. Serious shoppers will need to travel but, as noted above, the location makes it easy to get there. This place is definitely a bargain given the amenities, the beautiful grounds and ease of access relative to the price. We'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Laurence Zing
Reviews.Content: September 04, Very enjoyable stay, breakfast was a little basic but was enough to start the day. The pool was fantastic and the kids loved it. The room was spacious and clean, the AC worked fine but i did feel the doors were not very secure, so I would not leave anything valuable in the room. The bed was fine but ask for extra pillows! The location is a little remote from major shops etc, and at night seemed a little rough but on the whole we all felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Love the service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for three days and we love the service by the staff, especially cathy's from the front desk! I'm a writer/artist and I find this place very serene and quiet -- just about what I needed! And the wireless high speed internet network works very well too, wow! Thanks again, cathy -- you made us feel right at home! Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Time for new mattresses!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We checked in at 11pm. The neighborhood was a little rough. The bed was awful, it was as if someone had thrown a foam mattress on top of the old mattress. If you got too close to the edge, you'd roll off the bed! We forgot our shampoo and there was no small bottle of shampoo like in all the other BW's in which we've stayed. We washed our hair with a very small bar of soap, and barely had enough left for bathing. The heavy curtains covered the air conditioning unit, so we had to prop a chair under the curtains to hold them up so we could get cool air into the room. When we checked out the next morning, the two men at the desk barely spoke English, so it was difficult to communicate with them. We finally gave up and just left. For the price, it was fine, but I would never stay there for more than one night. We almost never stay in a AAA two diamond, and this is the perfect example of why.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: jJNB
Reviews.Content: We spent four days here on our May, 2002 vacation trip. Our upper floor room was spacious with two Queen Size beds. There was a separate dressing area adjoining the bath room. The upper floor rooms have balconies (the lower floor rooms have patios) overlooking the central courtyard, which has a large swiming pool. There was a desk with dataport for operating our laptop computer. Parking is fairly convenient, with "at your door" availabe for the lower floor rooms. There are restaurant and convention facilities in the complex, and other restaurants are nearby. All in all, this is a good "base camp" for visiting in the San Fernando Valley. We found the other services, such as the coin operated laundry and vending machines were also convenient. The room rates were fairly reasonable, especially considering the quality of the accommodations.

HotelInfo.Name: Valley Inn & Conference Center
HotelInfo.Address: 10621 Sepulveda Blvd, Mission Hills, Los Angeles, CA 91345
